file_content.text: The Empire won't come back to Corellia. I can promise you that.
We've got the Senate on vidcom. General Aves is waiting to introduce you.
One more fight, and the Legislature's ours. You know what to do.
This war has torn Corellia apart. The council will get what they deserve.
The faster you bring the Ion Wall up, the sooner we can take the Empire down.
Good, you're here. We've got trouble. You remember Councillor Belos?
Captain Cantarus tells me the Republic's on their way here. You can't attack the Legislature yet.
The Empire's taken control of the Ion Wall, Corellia's most powerful defense system. They're planning to use it against the Republic.
What does the Ion Wall do?
The Ion Wall?
It sends out an immense sonic wave that disables ships, security, heavy weaponry--nearly anything that requires power.
If this thing hits the Republic, the Empire keeps Corellia for good.
How did the Empire get control of the Ion Wall?
That was quick.
The Corellian Council offered it to them. Only we have the codes to operate it.
You happen to tell them our position and troop numbers, too?
This would have been nice to know earlier.
Now you tell us.
This thing's news to me, too. Apparently it wasn't something the Council Guard needed to know about.
The Ion Wall was only intended to be used during an invasion. It's a weapon of last resort.
But I have the codes. Why not turn it on the Legislature's defenses instead?
Won't the Empire expect a counterattack?
Seems too easy.
They've been led to believe it's an impossibility.
You know the Legislature best. Would this work?
What do you think, Cole?
Not sure what the Empire's installed, but it would definitely take out the building's security. What's the catch?
Works for me.
First, you'll need to point the Ion Wall's emitters at the Legislature. They've been concealed inside statues around Capitol Square.
Once the emitters are realigned, the Ion Wall can be activated. The controls are located inside Intra-Corellian Intelligence.
That's the catch. Intra-Corellian Intelligence was one of the first places the Empire took over. It'll be crawling with Imperials.
Could we sneak inside somehow?
Maybe there's a shortcut.
No chance. It's an intel bureau--for all we know, the Empire's listening to this comm call right now.
Some Republic troops or a CorSec squad might even the odds.
We have allies, don't we?
You head over with more than you've got, and the Empire will know something's up. Nice and quiet is our best strategy.
The more, the better.
The Imperials aren't the only danger, I'm afraid. Several members of the Dark Council arrived in Capitol Square a few days ago.
One of them, Darth Acharon, was dispatched to Intra-Corellian Intelligence to keep the Ion Wall safe. You'll have to get past him.
I'm after the Emperor. The Dark Council can't be much worse.
I can handle Acharon.
You'd know best. Me, I wouldn't bet my credits on it.
Where are the rest of the Dark Council members?
You mentioned others.
Inside the Legislature. One's protecting the Corellian Council. I feel more like we're being watched.
How does Darth Acharon fight?
It'll take good strategy.
I only met him briefly. He has a short temper and a powerful grip. If you can avoid both, you'll live.
Where's a Jedi-for-hire when you need one?
I don't like my odds.
Jedi have lightsabers for a reason. One good shot is all you need.
I've never heard of the Dark Council.
The Dark Council?
They govern the Empire according to the Emperor's wishes. Only the most powerful Sith in the galaxy earn a seat.
By helping us, you're crossing the Dark Council too.
You'd better be careful.
I'm well aware. I hope this proves to you that I'm truly on the Republic's side.
I should go. There's a secure line from Intra-Corellian Intelligence to my office. Contact me once you've activated the Ion Wall.
The Guardhouse is still linked to the Legislature. We can't control their defenses, but we can tell when they go down.
I'll get CorSec and the Republic into position. The minute you activate the Ion Wall, we attack.
Councillor Belos's assistant is waiting for you. Personally, I'd take my chances with the Empire's droids.
General Aves knows the status of the neutron emitters.
If the Republic can't move, neither can CorSec. We have to get those neutron emitters shut down.
Gosse is helping her sept settle in. I didn't thank you properly earlier.
You're a member of the Republic and our ally. It's my duty to protect you.
That's what Jedi do.
Knowing your duty isn't always the same as doing it.
I hope neither of you were scarred by Imperial captivity.
Glad you're all right.
The Empire's turned Coronet City into a battlefield. Spending a few hours as their prisoner was nothing.
You risked your life to help the Republic. I just returned the favor.
No thanks necessary.
That's worth some applause. Not everyone on Corellia does the right thing.
Rescuing handsome men's a hobby of mine.
[Flirt] It was a pleasure.
I'll have to make sure to get captured again.
You wouldn't be much help from an Imperial cell.
Seemed like a smart move.
I'm betting I wouldn't be very pleasant to be around either.
Do we have access to the Selonian tunnels?
Did it pay off?
In the future, try not getting captured.
Don't get used to it.
I'll keep that in mind the next time I'm surrounded by armed Imperials.
Your actions gained you more than one ally. Gosse had her people confirm the Selonian tunnels ran underneath Coronet Shipping.
The Selonians were forced out of the tunnels by the Empire, but plenty of predators moved in afterwards. You'll have to be careful.
If the Imperials know about the tunnels, won't they know I'm coming?
The tunnels aren't a secret?
They know they're empty and dangerous. They have no idea where the tunnels actually run.
They won't be a problem.
Exterminating rodents isn't in my job description.
I'm not here to clean tunnels.
The Selonians are trained warriors, but they barely survived an Imperial siege. They're in no condition to fight.
As long as you're down there, you could clear some of those predators out. The Selonians would like their homes back someday.
The tunnels will bypass the shock troops, but their commander, Captain Granta, will be inside. Don't underestimate him.
Whatever Captain Granta has planned, I'll be ready.
I'm ready for anything.
Better be. Otherwise this whole plan goes belly up with you.
Would a man like Captain Granta listen to reason?
Maybe I can negotiate.
Shock troops are used for one thing--direct assault. Negotiation's not in their vocabulary.
What kind of tactics are we talking?
Any specific reason why?
The neutron emitters, the spaceport patrols, attacking the Selonians--all Captain Granta's ideas.
Imperials usually underestimate me.
Their mistake, not mine.
If Captain Granta loses a battle, he just starts another one. Don't give him that chance.
What do I do once I'm inside?
And after I deal with him?
If he's as tough as the shock troops I've fought so far, I won't have any problems.
Granta doesn't scare me.
Don't judge Captain Granta by his troops. The man's captain for a reason.
You'll find the neutron emitters outside, somewhere with a clear shot at the tram system. This spike should override any Imperial security.
The neutron emitters will interfere with portable comm transmissions. Once you're inside, contact me through Coronet Shipping's system.
We were starting to wonder if you'd make it back. Glad you didn't bring the Empire with you.
The Selonians made it to the Red Light Sector. The Imperials were too scattered by your attack to stop them.
We'll show the Empire what Corellia really thinks of them.
